sen.j: 祭日（さいじつ）とは、宗教儀礼上重要な祭祀を行う日のこと。
sen.e: On ritual days important religious rites are performed.
On ritual days important religious rites are performed.
A ritual day is a day on which an important religious rite is performed.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を追加しました。

sen.j: 一般的には以下の意味で用いられる。
sen.e: A ritual day generally refers to one of the following.
A ritual day generally refers to one of the following.
A ritual day generally refers to one of the following.

sen.j: 皇室の祭典が行われる日。
sen.e: A day on which an imperial ritual is performed.
A day on which an imperial ritual is performed.
A day on which an imperial ritual is performed.

sen.j: 大祭日と小祭日。
sen.e: A day on which a major or minor rite is conducted.
A day on which a major or minor rite is conducted.
A day on which a major or minor rite is conducted.

sen.j: 本項で詳述。
sen.e: Its details are explained on this page.
Details are explained on this page.
Details are explained on this page.

sen.j: 神道で霊祭を行う日。
sen.e: A day on which the spirits of the departed are commemorated in Shinto.
A day on which the spirits of the departed are commemorated in Shinto.
A day on which the spirits of the departed are commemorated in Shinto.

sen.j: 斎日（いみび）。
sen.e: This is a day of ritual abstinence.
This is a day of ritual abstinence.
This is a day of ritual abstinence.

sen.j: キリスト教の教会暦で祭祀が行われる日。
sen.e: A day on which a Christian rite is performed according to the ecclesiastical calendar.
A day on which a Christian rite is performed according to the ecclesiastical calendar.
A day on which a Christian rite is performed according to the ecclesiastical calendar.

sen.j: 祝い日。
sen.e: This is a day of celebration.
This is a day of celebration.
This is a day of celebration.

sen.j: 神社で祭りの行われる日。
sen.e: A day on which a festival is celebrated at Shinto shrines.
A day on which a festival is celebrated at Shinto shrines.
A day on which a festival is celebrated at Shinto shrines.

sen.j: 皇室祭祀令により定められた大祭日及び小祭日を指す。
sen.e: Ritual days refer to the days of major or minor religious rites specified by the Imperial Household's Regulations on Ritual Observances.
Ritual days refer to the days of major or minor religious rites specified by Imperial Household's Regulations on Ritual Observances.
Ritual days refer to the days of major or minor religious rites specified by Imperial Household Religious Rites Ordinance.
sen.cmt: 皇室祭祀令→ Imperial Household Religious Rites Ordinance としました。

sen.j: 大祭日の一部は祝日とともに国家の休日として法制化されたことから、祭日と祝日を合わせて祝祭日と称することも多い。
sen.e: Since some of the major ritual days have been stipulated by law as national holidays, they are often called high days and holidays, combining the two meanings.
Since some of the major ritual days have been stipulated by law as national holidays, they are often called high days and holidays, combining the two meanings.
Since some of the major ritual days have been stipulated by law as national holidays, they are often called high days and holidays, combining the two meanings.

sen.j: 皇室祭祀令は昭和22年5月2日に廃止されたため、現在日本で法定の祭日は存在しない。
sen.e: Currently, there is no legal ritual day in Japan as the Imperial Household's Regulations on Ritual Observances was abolished on May 2, 1947.
Currently, there is no legal ritual days in Japan as the Imperial Household's Regulations on Ritual Observances were abolished on May 2, 1947.
Currently, there is no legal ritual days in Japan as the Imperial Household Religious Rites Ordinance were abolished on May 2, 1947.
sen.cmt: 皇室祭祀令→ Imperial Household Religious Rites Ordinance としました。

tit.j: 大祭日（皇室祭祀令8条・9条）
tit.e: Major ritual days (under Articles 8 and 9 of the Imperial Household's Regulations on Ritual Observances)
Major ritual days (under Articles 8 and 9 of the Imperial Household's Regulations on Ritual Observances)
Major ritual days (under Articles 8 and 9 of the Imperial Household Religious Rites Ordinance)
tit.cmt: 皇室祭祀令→ Imperial Household Religious Rites Ordinance としました。

sen.j: 天皇自ら親祭する日。
sen.e: On the major ritual days the Emperor himself performs the rites.
On the major ritual days the Emperor himself performs the rites.
On the major ritual days the Emperor himself performs the rites.

sen.j: 期日の定まっているもの
sen.e: The following major rites are performed on specified dates.
The following major rites are performed on specified dates.
The following major rites are performed on specified dates.

sen.j: 元始祭（1月3日）
sen.e: Genshisai (the Festival of Origins) (January 3).
sen.cmt: 英名はEncyclopaedia of Shinto他、一般の辞書にも。
sen.e: Genshisai (the Festival of Origins) (January 3).
Genshisai (the Festival of Origins) (January 3)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 紀元節祭（2月1日）
sen.e: Kigensetsu sai (the rites for commemorating the founding of the nation through the accession of the first Emperor Jimmu) (February 1).
sen.cmt: 紀元節は2月11日の可能性があります。上記資料に英名があがっていないため内容を注記
sen.e: Kigensetsu sai (the rites for commemorating the founding of the nation through the accession of the first Emperor Jimmu) (February 1).
Kigensetsu sai (the rites for commemorating the founding of the nation through the accession of the first Emperor Jinmu) (February 11)
sen.cmt: 翻訳者様のご指摘どおり、2月11日のようですので、左記のようにいたしました。

sen.j: 神武天皇祭（4月3日）
sen.e: Jimmutenno sai (the rites for commemorating the demise of Emperor Jimmu) (April 3).
sen.cmt: 上記資料に英名があがっていないため内容を注記
sen.e: Jimmutenno sai (the rites for commemorating the demise of Emperor Jimmu) (April 3).
Jinmutenno sai (the rites for commemorating the demise of Emperor Jinmu) (April 3)

sen.j: 神嘗祭（10月17日）
sen.e: Kannamesai (The First Fruits Festival) (October 17).
sen.cmt: 英名はEncyclopaedia of Shintoによる。
sen.e: Kannamesai (The First Fruits Festival) (October 17).
Kannamesai (The First Fruits Festival) (October 17)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.e: Niinamesai (The Harvest Festival) (November 23 and 24).
Niinamesai (The Harvest Festival) (November 23 and 24).
Niinamesai (The Harvest Festival) (November 23 and 24)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 期日の定めの無いもの
sen.e: The following major rites are conducted on unspecified dates.
The following major rites are conducted on unspecified dates.
The following major rites are conducted on unspecified dates.

sen.j: 春季皇霊祭・春季神殿祭 （春分日）
sen.e: Shunki koreisai (the Spring Commemoration for the Imperial Spirits) /Shunki shindensai (the Spring Thanksgiving) (the Spring Equinox Day).
sen.cmt: いずれも定訳はないもよう。The Encyclopaedia内でも統一されていない。皇霊祭の別称（というかこれも説明）にSpring Imperial Ancestral Riteもあり。神殿祭は皇霊祭の一貫として、天皇が宮中の神殿で神恩感謝を行う祭祀。ここでは上記を英語で説明。
sen.e: Shunki koreisai (the Spring Commemoration for Imperial Spirits) /Shunki shindensai (Spring Thanksgiving) (Spring Equinox Day).
Shunki koreisai (the Spring Commemoration for Imperial Spirits) /Shunki shindensai (Spring Thanksgiving) (Spring Equinox Day)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 秋季皇霊祭・秋季神殿祭 （秋分日）
sen.e: Shuki koreisai (the Autumn Commemoration for the Imperial Spirits) / Shuki shindensai (the Autumn Thanksgiving) (the Autumn Equinox Day).
Shuki koreisai (the Autumn Commemoration for the Imperial Spirits) / Shuki shindensai (the Autumn Thanksgiving) (the Autumn Equinox Day).
Shuki koreisai (the Autumn Commemoration for the Imperial Spirits) / Shuki shindensai (the Autumn Thanksgiving) (the Autumn Equinox Day)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 先帝祭 先帝の崩御した日
sen.e: Senteisai Memorial Ceremony for the previous emperor (on the anniversary of his demise).
Senteisai Memorial Ceremony for the previous emperor (on the anniversary of his demise).
Senteisai Memorial Ceremony for the previous emperor (on the anniversary of his demise)

sen.e: Memorial Ceremony for Emperor Komei (January 30) in the Meiji period.
Memorial Ceremony Emperor Komei (January 30) during the Meiji period.
Memorial Ceremony for Emperor Komei (January 30) during the Meiji period

sen.j: 大正期 明治天皇祭（7月30日）
sen.e: Memory Ceremony for Emperor Meiji (July 30) in the Taisho period.
Memorial Ceremony Emperor Meiji (July 30) during the Taisho period.
Memorial Ceremony for Emperor Meiji (July 30) during the Taisho period

Shikinensai Memorial Ceremony for the spirits of the three imperial ancestors preceding the last emperor.

sen.j: 皇妣たる皇后の式年祭
sen.e: Shikinensai Memorial Ceremony for the emperor's deceased mother
Shikinensai Memorial Ceremony for the emperor's deceased mother
Shikinensai Memorial Ceremony for the emperor's deceased mother

sen.j: （式年祭は3年、5年、10年、20年、30年、40年、100年及び以後100年毎に実施される）
sen.e: (The Shikinensai Memorial Ceremony is held three, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, and one hundred years after the death of an emperor, with subsequent ceremonies every hundred years).
sen.cmt: 「天皇の死後（３年、５年、…)後」を追加しました。
sen.e: (The Shikinensai Memorial Ceremony is held three, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, and one hundred years after the death of an emperor, with subsequent ceremonies every hundred years).
(The Shikinensai Memorial Ceremony is held three, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, and one hundred years after the death of an emperor, with subsequent ceremonies every hundred years).

tit.j: 小祭日（皇室祭祀令20条・21条）
tit.e: Minor ritual days (under Articles 20 and 21 of the Ordinance of Imperial Household Rites)
Minor ritual days (under Articles 20 and 21 of the Ordinance of Imperial Household Rites)

tit.cmt: 皇室祭祀令→ Imperial Household Religious Rites Ordinance としました。

sen.j: 天皇自らが礼拝し、掌典長が祭典を行う日。
sen.e: On the minor ritual days the emperor himself performs the obeisances and the Shotencho (Head Officiant) performs the rites.
On the minor ritual days the emperor himself performs the obeisances and the Shotencho (Head Officiant) performs the rites.
On the minor ritual days the emperor himself performs the obeisances and the Shotencho (Head Officiant) performs the rites.
